intro: Catasetum fimbriatum var. aurantiacum, commonly known as the golden lip orchid, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, elongated flowers with bright orange lip and yellow petals. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are highly fragrant and bloom during the warmer months. The species is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its unique coloration and ornamental value.
